intro: Barbarea arcuata var. pinnatisecta, commonly known as the narrow-leaved winter cress, is a flowering plant in the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its finely pinnatisected leaves, which give it a delicate, fern-like appearance. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes, typical of the mustard family. It is a herbaceous perennial that thrives in moist, temperate climates. Barbarea arcuata var. pinnatisecta is often found in disturbed soils and can be invasive in certain regions.
